definitions.definition: To divest of all covering; to make bare or naked ; to strip .
examples: He denuded himself of his clothes.
Widespread deforestation has led to lands being denuded .

definitions.definition: To remove (something) of its possessions or assets .
examples: Their property was seized, denuded and confiscated.
The service was denuded of its capacity to deliver.

main_definition: To divest of all covering; to make bare or naked ; to strip .
secondary_definitions: To remove (something) of its possessions or assets .
